description: Finds available schedules that meet the specified criteria. You can search for an available schedule no more than 3 months in advance. You must meet the minimum required duration of 1,200 hours per year. For example, the minimum daily schedule is 4 hours, the minimum weekly schedule is 24 hours, and the minimum monthly schedule is 100 hours. After you find a schedule that meets your needs, call  PurchaseScheduledInstances to purchase Scheduled Instances with that schedule.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. availability-zone - The Availability Zone (for example, us-west-2a). instance-type - The instance type (for example, c4.large). platform - The platform ( Linux/UNIX or Windows). (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

parameters.name: FirstSlotStartTimeRange
parameters.description: The time period for the first schedule to start. The earliest date and time, in UTC, for the Scheduled Instance to start. The latest date and time, in UTC, for the Scheduled Instance to start. This value must be later than or equal to the earliest date and at most three months in the future.

nested_params.name: EarliestTime
nested_params.description: The earliest date and time, in UTC, for the Scheduled Instance to start.

nested_params.name: LatestTime
nested_params.description: The latest date and time, in UTC, for the Scheduled Instance to start. This value must be later than or equal to the earliest date and at most three months in the future.

parameters.name: Recurrence
parameters.description: The schedule recurrence. Frequency (string) --- The frequency ( Daily, Weekly, or Monthly). Interval (integer) --- The interval quantity. The interval unit depends on the value of Frequency. For example, every 2 weeks or every 2 months. OccurrenceDays (list) --- The days. For a monthly schedule, this is one or more days of the month (1-31). For a weekly schedule, this is one or more days of the week (1-7, where 1 is Sunday). You can't specify this value with a daily schedule. If the occurrence is relative to the end of the month, you can specify only a single day. (integer) --- OccurrenceRelativeToEnd (boolean) --- Indicates whether the occurrence is relative to the end of the specified week or month. OccurrenceUnit (string) --- The unit for OccurrenceDays ( DayOfWeek or DayOfMonth). This value is required for a monthly schedule. You can't specify DayOfWeek with a weekly schedule. You can't specify this value with a daily schedule.

nested_params.name: Frequency
nested_params.description: The frequency ( Daily, Weekly, or Monthly).

nested_params.name: Interval
nested_params.description: The interval quantity. The interval unit depends on the value of Frequency. For example, every 2 weeks or every 2 months.

nested_params.name: OccurrenceDays
nested_params.description: The days. For a monthly schedule, this is one or more days of the month (1-31). For a weekly schedule, this is one or more days of the week (1-7, where 1 is Sunday). You can't specify this value with a daily schedule. If the occurrence is relative to the end of the month, you can specify only a single day.

nested_params.name: OccurrenceRelativeToEnd
nested_params.description: Indicates whether the occurrence is relative to the end of the specified week or month. You can't specify this value with a daily schedule.

nested_params.name: OccurrenceUnit
nested_params.description: The unit for OccurrenceDays ( DayOfWeek or DayOfMonth). This value is required for a monthly schedule. You can't specify DayOfWeek with a weekly schedule. You can't specify this value with a daily schedule.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

nested_items.name: ScheduledInstanceAvailabilitySet
nested_items.description: Information about the available Scheduled Instances.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: AvailableInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of available instances.

nested_items.name: FirstSlotStartTime
nested_items.description: The time period for the first schedule to start.

nested_items.name: HourlyPrice
nested_items.description: The hourly price for a single instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type. You can specify one of the C3, C4, M4, or R3 instance types.

nested_items.name: MaxTermDurationInDays
nested_items.description: The maximum term. The only possible value is 365 days.

nested_items.name: MinTermDurationInDays
nested_items.description: The minimum term. The only possible value is 365 days.

nested_items.name: NetworkPlatform
nested_items.description: The network platform.

nested_items.name: Platform
nested_items.description: The platform ( Linux/UNIX or Windows).

nested_items.name: PurchaseToken
nested_items.description: The purchase token. This token expires in two hours.

nested_items.name: Recurrence
nested_items.description: The schedule recurrence.

nested_items.name: Frequency
nested_items.description: The frequency ( Daily, Weekly, or Monthly).

nested_items.name: Interval
nested_items.description: The interval quantity. The interval unit depends on the value of frequency. For example, every 2 weeks or every 2 months.

nested_items.name: OccurrenceDaySet
nested_items.description: The days. For a monthly schedule, this is one or more days of the month (1-31). For a weekly schedule, this is one or more days of the week (1-7, where 1 is Sunday).
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: OccurrenceRelativeToEnd
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the occurrence is relative to the end of the specified week or month.

nested_items.name: OccurrenceUnit
nested_items.description: The unit for occurrenceDaySet ( DayOfWeek or DayOfMonth).

nested_items.name: SlotDurationInHours
nested_items.description: The number of hours in the schedule.

nested_items.name: TotalScheduledInstanceHours
nested_items.description: The total number of hours for a single instance for the entire term.
